results.title: The Emperor and the assassin
results.creator_credit: New Wave Entertainmnet, Beijing Film Studio, Chen Kaige, Shirley Kao and Satoru Iseki
results.brief_description: The most expensive film produced in China at its date of production, this historical epic is based on the event of the forced unification of China in the third century. By 221 BC, after centuries of civil war, seven kingdoms were dominant in China. At this time the ruler of the kingdom of Qin, Ying Zheng (Li Xuejian), raised to believe he had an ancestral duty to unify all of China, undertook a brutal conquest to achieve his goal, thus becoming the country’s first emperor. In this interpretation Zheng is aided in his quest by his lover, Lady Zhao (Gong Li), who devises a fake assassination plot to justify an invasion of the neighboring kingdom of Yan, enlisting the help of Yan assassin Jing Ke (Zhang Fengyi) who is trying to give up his bloody past. As the King becomes increasingly ruthless and bloodthirsty, Lady Zhao shifts her political and romantic allegiances to the assassin. Filled with the back-stabbing imperial politics, murderous betrayals, acts of cruelty and bloody mass slaughter usually associated with Shakespearean tragedy, the emotional impact and tension of the complex narrative is at times dwarfed by the elaborately staged, large-scale battle sequences and the visual grandeur of the landscape. Written by Chen Kaige and Wang Peigong. Photography, Zhao Fei, music, Zhao Jiping.
results.creator_credit_for_label: New Wave Entertainmnet, Beijing Film Studio, Chen Kaige, Shirley Kao and Satoru Iseki

results.title: The Emperor and the abbot
results.creator_credit: Barry Levinson, Sebastian Robinson and Hemisphere Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Storybook International”.
An unkind Emperor decides that the local Abbot is enjoying his life too much and gives him three almost impossible riddles to solve. A shepherd comes to the rescue of the Abbot and saves him from humiliation. A French/Austrian tale.

results.title: The Emperor's oblong pancake. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Fine Arts and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description: An animated version of the story by Peter Hughes about the emperor who tried to change all the round objects in his kingdom into oblong ones. Narrated by Edward Everett Horton. Suitable for lower and middle primary levels.

results.title: The Emperor's new groove
results.creator_credit: Randy Fullmer, Walt Disney Pictures and Mark Dindal
results.brief_description: Emperor Kuzco is an arrogant and selfish leader and his latest plan involves destroying a hill top village to build a summer palace. He invites village elder Pancha in to discuss options, but only to find out the best place to get the sun. When the amnesiac emperor awakes to find himself turned into a llama, he blames the kindly Pancho, unaware that his conniving advisor, the wizened Yzma, and brawny brainless sidekick Kronk, have usurped his power. Demanding he be returned to the palace, Kuzco pushes Pancha’s faith that to the limit that all human beings possess goodness. Featuring the voices of David Spade, John Goodman, Eartha Kitt, Patrick Warburton, Wendie Malick and music by Tom Jones and Sting, this witty Disney animation espouses the virtues of friendship and kindness to others.

results.title: The Emperor's New Clothes
results.brief_description: Animated puppets are used in telling the Hans Andersen tale about the tailor who deceives a vain king and his court, and is eventually exposed by a candid child who sees that the king is not actually wearing any clothes at all.

results.title: The Emperor's new clothes
results.creator_credit: Carole F Schwartz and McGraw-Hill Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Children’s classic story series”.
A live action film that tells the tale of an emperor who employs two tailors who make him a special robe. What he doesn’t know is that these two rogues are not tailors at all and when the emperor appears in public in his special new robe, no one can quite believe their eyes. Adapted from Hans Christian Andersen’s well-loved tale.

results.title: The Emperor's new armour
results.brief_description: A humorous animated film which comments on consumerism and the arms race. Presents a story about an emperor who is persuaded by three glib salesmen to buy a made-to-measure, deluxe, drip-dry, stainless steel, suit of ‘soft’ armour which he does not need and which his kingdom cannot afford.

results.title: The Emily Rodda video
results.creator_credit: Christine McCaul Gleitzman, Mark Waters and Insight Profile
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Insight profile”.
Emily Rodda became a writer by accident. One night, she made up a story for her daughter about a young girl and her experiences throughout the day. Her daughter asked her to repeat the story the following night. Using everyday examples, Emily explains that anyone can be a writer. She shares her thoughts on how to develop small ideas based on simple objects, people and situations - into large ones, and then how to extend on these ideas to create a novel, using what she calls, the simple spell. The simple spell is just two words: What if?

results.title: The Emerging eskimo
results.creator_credit: Brayton-Kendall Productions and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Documentary film showing the effect of colonisation on the Eskimo socio-culture. Since the first arrival of the Europeans, the selling potential of Alaskan resources was quickly realised. This caused devastating damage to ecological aspects vital to Eskimo survival. In addition tho this, the film shows how colonial influence has caused ruptures in Eskimo tradition and religion.
